page.title: 15THE POPULATION OF GROVE.
page.content: The current population of Grove appears to be about 90 with less than 10 being of school-age.Some of the older inhabitants originally worked on the Grove Estate,which included the fine Grove Hall,woods and acres of farmland.The whole estate was sold in 1946,when the estate workers were give the chance of purchasing their homes.Hithertoo,the familt tradition of all villagers was to work and live on the estate.In turn,the estate woods and lands were sold to private farmers and the Great Hall demolished.A bungalw,Bodway House,now stands in the middle of the former front lawns.Most of the local population are still involved in agriculture and a number commute daily to Retford.Some cherished memories of the Great Hall are retold by visitors, who lived their as displced persons,in 1945.
